        Specified by:

      • containsScheme

        public boolean containsScheme(java.lang.String name,
                              boolean projectScheme)
        Specified by:
        containsScheme in interface SchemesModel<EditorColorsScheme>
        Parameters:
        name - The scheme to check.
        projectScheme - Level of the scheme to check. If schemes model does not support project level schemes then the parameter is always equal to false.
        Returns:
        True if a scheme by the given name already exists.

      • differsFromDefault

        public boolean differsFromDefault(EditorColorsScheme scheme)
        Specified by:
        differsFromDefault in interface SchemesModel<EditorColorsScheme>
        Parameters:
        scheme - The scheme to check.
        Returns:
        True if scheme's settings differ from default values (presets). The method is called only if SchemesModel.canResetScheme(Scheme) returns true.

      • createComponent

        public javax.swing.JComponent createComponent()
        Description copied from interface: UnnamedConfigurable
        Creates new Swing form that enables user to configure the settings. Usually this method is called on the EDT, so it should not take a long time.

        Also this place is designed to allocate resources (subscriptions/listeners etc.)

        Specified by:
        createComponent in interface UnnamedConfigurable
        Overrides:
        createComponent in class SearchableConfigurable.Parent.Abstract
        Returns:
        new Swing form to show, or null if it cannot be created

      • selectOrEditColor

        public static boolean selectOrEditColor(DataContext context,
                                        java.lang.String search,
                                        java.lang.String name)
        Shows a requested page to edit a color settings. If current data context represents a setting dialog that can open a requested page, it will be opened. Otherwise, the new dialog will be opened. The simplest way to get a data context is 
        DataManager.getInstance().getDataContext(myComponent)
        where is myComponent is a JComponent in a Swing hierarchy. A specific color can be requested by the search text.
        Parameters:
        context - a data context to find Settings or a parent for dialog
        search - a text to find on the found page
        name - a name of a page to find via findSubConfigurable(String)
        Returns:
        true if a color was shown to edit, false if a requested page does not exist

      • selectOrEditColor

        public static boolean selectOrEditColor(DataContext context,
                                        java.lang.String search,
                                        java.lang.Class<?> type)
        Shows a requested page to edit a color settings. If current data context represents a setting dialog that can open a requested page, it will be opened. Otherwise, the new dialog will be opened. The simplest way to get a data context is 
        DataManager.getInstance().getDataContext(myComponent)
        where is myComponent is a JComponent in a Swing hierarchy. A specific color can be requested by the search text.
        Parameters:
        context - a data context to find Settings or a parent for dialog
        search - a text to find on the found page
        type - a type of a page to find via findSubConfigurable(Class)
        Returns:
        true if a color was shown to edit, false if a requested page does not exist
